Fields.DialogueText: The mighty walls gleam in the sunrise, as our boats breach the shore...
What song is that?
It's something original, more or less. It's based on the Trojan War.
I thought that there was already a song – the Iliad.
That only covers the final year of the war. There was a long journey to reach Troy, and then a long fight there.
Fair point.
It was the end of an age for the pagan gods and for mortals. I wonder if such an end is coming to us now...

Fields.MenuText: The Trojan War wasn't an end – otherwise, we wouldn't be here to talk about it.
It's only the end if we decide to give up.
We'll just have to see where fate takes us.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. An end can also be a new beginning, a new journey.
Yes. We cannot surrender to the darkness.
Indeed. Surely the Lord will guide us to victory.
Well, up ahead is our own battlefield. Lovely, isn't it?
I would much rather besiege Troy than try to break through this mess.... but we must do our duty.
Yes. Full steam ahead! Let the songs of war cry out!
@BATTLE
Ha ha ha! You always make great choices with movies, Amph!
Thanks. Keep complimenting me like that, and you'll make me blush, Captain. It must be my love for the arts that gives me the right taste.
Huh. I never figure out how they make those sound effects so realistic in these pictures.
That's funny. I don't recall explosions at this point in the film.
Oh, don't tell me...
Okay, I won't. But you still know what this means.
I know – Morganas are on the prowl.
So what are your orders, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Save the popcorn and hot dogs!
Stop the movie. We can finish it later.
Turn off the projector - don't want anyone to get confused by the sounds.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent point. We must be thrifty with our resources, after all, and such good cuisine should not go to waste.
All right. It's not quite the same when you have an inadvertent intermission, but I still want to watch the rest of it with you.
I see. Yes, we wouldn't want anyone to panic about bombs going off on the ship or something like that.
I'm sorry that the Morganas spoiled the movie, Captain.
That's fine, Perth. I was just happy to see part of it with you.
I feel the same way.
Let's make our own ending then. We defeat the Morganas, and then...
@BATTLE
And then we ride off into the sunset? That sounds like a happy ending to me!
*BOOM*
*ALARM*
O my princess, beyond the stars, will your smile ever return?
Nice song.
Thanks. You know I enjoy singing a few tunes to myself every now and then.
It is pretty nice to gaze out at everything topside.
Yes, and the music echoes nicely up into the sky.
It echoes down into the ship, too - that's what led me up here, actually.
It did? I'm sorry. I actually came up here so no one would hear it down below.
Why would you do that?
Mostly, I don't think they would appreciate the melody of the songs. Plus, here I don't have to worry about being interrupted.

Fields.MenuText: Music means more when it's shared.
You can't hide from others.
It is nice to get alone to yourself every now and then.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? I just don't know if they would understand it.
I suppose you're right. Even up here, I am still connected to everyone.
It is. But I shouldn't always be alone.
I see a Morgana over there. We need to get prepared.
Got it!
@BATTLE
I'm sure they would, if you reached out to them.
Just one thing first. I am glad you came up to hear me sing, Captain.
I don't want you to ever feel like you're alone, Perth.
Oh...
*ALARM*
Hey, Perth. Something wrong?
Oh, nothing. It's just that, I just don't know why you go to the effort of recruiting some of those other Belles.
We're all part of the war, so we need to cooperate.
I'd rather keep my distance from some of that riffraff.
Riffraff?
I was trying to find the politest word for their kind. Do you know some of the customs they have?
Why are you acting like this?
Oh... I understand. If you like them more than me, I'll be fine.

Fields.MenuText: You know, you could attempt befriending them.
Perth, please don't insult them. This is a war, and we need our friends to stay friendly.
I don't want you to feel isolated, Perth. We can each have friends and people we connect with.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose so...
I'm sorry. It's just... kind of tough for me to like them.
You're right. It's good to have friends with you.
I'm sorry you feel this way.
Maybe I'm just experiencing a bit of jealousy, Captain. I don't want other Belles to have your attention.
You have my attention right now.
@BATTLE
And now, as if on cue, here come the Morganas to take it away. How unfair!
*ALARM*
This is a great meal, Amphy.
You like it? I was a little worried - I don't have much experience in this sort of cuisine.
No, no, I think that helped give your own touch to the style of food. When did you learn how to barbecue?
The cook on board has been teaching me, though we haven't reached the final lesson yet.
Well, so far, she's a great teacher.
I do admire her quite a bit.
Say, Perth? How are things going with you and Houston?
We've started exchanging letters - I think it's quite fun, actually. Why do you ask?
Who, me?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, no reason...
I'm just glad that you have a good friend.
You worked hard to find the courage to talk to Houston - I just wanted to know how things were going.

Fields.DialogueText: If I didn't know better, I'd think you were just a bit jealous, Captain.
Me too. It's nice to have another Belle I can talk to.
Ah, of course. I know it took a while for me reach out to her, but now that I have, we get along swimmingly!
Thank you for sharing with me.
It was my pleasure. I enjoyed chatting with you. We should do this more often.
I'd enjoy the good food and the great company... but it's time to get to work again.
At least we finished the meal this time. That's better than most of our dates.
@BATTLE
This was a date?
Maybe it was... at least it felt like one to me. Ah, no time to discuss it now. We need to get to the bridge!
*ALARM*
Ay, me!
She speaks! O, speak again, bright angel!
Ah... Here I was, thinking you were talking with someone, when both of them were really you.
I was trying to convert some of Shakespeare's words to a more musical form. The toughest part about it is getting the right tenor for each voice, and then changing again and again.
That does sound difficult.
It is, but what choice do I have? I want the different speakers to stand out from each other.
Maybe you could get other people to help fill in the voices.
No, no, they would not get the art of it, and would just jam up the whole process.

Fields.MenuText: Try me. I might surprise you.
You should give other people a chance. Even if it's only one person.
No one is perfect at first. You just have to teach them.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... You sound quite confident, Captain. I like that.
Maybe you're right.
Good point. I'm not sure if I would be the best teacher, though.
Getting others involved in the music might work - though I'm not optimistic.
That would help spread a merry tune to everyone.
Hey, Captain, would you like to... try a duet with me?
I'd love to.
Great! Let us begin – after an intermission to get rid of the Morgana background noise, first.
@BATTLE
You'd be great. Trust me.
What? Are you talking to me, Perth?
*ALARM*
Keeping an eye out for Morganas, Perth?
Trying to, at least. This wind keeps making me lose my olive-branch crown. Do you see where it went?
Here it is. Is this a call back to ancient Greece?
Impressive, Captain! Yes, it certainly is. Olympic champions used to be awarded them after proving themselves victorious.
Huh. I wouldn't have guessed you were interested in the Olympics.
I'm... not really.
You're confusing me, Perth.
In truth, my connection with Greece is like that of an amateur tourist. Superficial knowledge about many things, but only ones that interest me.
I still think it's pretty nice.
Still, maybe I should find something that actually has some meaning for me, rather than just a random trinket.

Fields.MenuText: I think it looks great on you.
Instead of throwing it away, couldn't you just put more thought into its meaning?
Actually, I feel that it really suits you – a fierce warrior and champion of the seas.

Fields.DialogueText: You really think so? I guess I could hang onto it for a little longer... if you like it.
You're right. I can still learn more about the Olympics, and show that I care.
I've never thought about it that way before... Are you trying to flatter me, Captain?
Try to stay focused. Promise?
I'll try not to lose my head... or my crown.
Time to get ready. Let's go, Miss Champion.
Thanks, Captain. Maybe one day I truly will win...
Win what?
I'll tell you later. For right now, we have a fight to win.
@BATTLE
Hup, two, three, four! Oof, two, three, argh!
What's wrong, Amph?
Nothing! I'm just exercising.
This is new. Mind if I join you?
Sure. I'll need all the help I can get if I want to win a gold medal.
Gold medal?
Well, I got inspired by our talk earlier about my olive branches. I may not be worthy of that honor yet, but I can earn it.
You mean...?
Yes. I am going to be part of the Olympics. If I can make it. I don't know – I'm more used to singing than athletics.

Fields.MenuText: I will believe in you all the way, Amphy.
I hear that strong lungs are critical for athletes. You already have that down, so don't worry.
I would think there are some... logistical impediments to a Belle joining the games.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Captain. Your confidence means a lot to me.
You're right - I just have to draw on my existing skills, and apply them in new directions.
Don't rain on my parade, Captain!
Well, now that the opening stretches are done, what's next?
I'm not sure. Any ideas?
Looks like a solution just came to me – let's warm up with some live target practice.
@BATTLE
When we exercise together, does it count as a date?
Not now, Perth!
*ALARM*
Brace yourself. They could start lobbing shells at us any time now.
Or maybe we'll get to shoot them first this time.
That would be nice.
@BATTLE
Hang in there, Perth! Are you okay?
I've had worse. How's everything else going?
We're still taking heavy fire from the Morganas.
Damn it! Why can't I be stronger?
Anyway, we have orders to fall back for now. Coming?
Maybe.
Perth, that was a rhetorical question. Let's get out of here!
Damn! If I were stronger, or smarter, maybe we all wouldn't be in such danger right now. And here I wanted to become an Olympic champion...

Fields.MenuText: So get a hold of yourself. You can do this!
You may not be strong enough to be an Olympic champion right now, but one day you will be.
You can't give up now, Perth. Your song is going to live on, and you're going to sing it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll give it my best shot...
You're right. I will survive and one day, I will win.
Yes. I just have to keep believing that the music will continue to shine out into the darkness.
So come on, Amphy, please.
Don't worry, I'm not out of this yet. Here I go!
@BATTLE
Perth? I'm a bit worried about you. How are you?
I assure you, Captain, everything should be sorted out before long.
Good.
You... actually seem concerned about me, Captain. Are you sure you only want to ask about repairs?
Oh? Maybe we're all a little dazed since that last battle.
I didn't say that I minded it. Honestly, I'm often concerned about your well-being, too.
As long as we avoid unnecessary contact, we should be fine.
What did you just say?!
Contact with the enemy, of course. What did you think I meant?
I thought you meant with me.
Why would I -?
It will have to wait. We're going to have more company soon! What are your orders, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Think strategically. Let's avoid taking on a larger Morgana fleet if we don't have to.
Focus on getting any repairs done first.
Stand your ground. They've pushed us far enough.

Fields.DialogueText: Roger. We're all a little bushed, so best to work together.
I'll get them done in a jiffy.
That's right. Now it's time to really fight.
Here they come!
Let's hope this round goes better.
@BATTLE
(some time later)
So, have you thought of which sport you are going to try out for at the Olympics?
At first, I was thinking of running, but that might be problematic. Then I came up with a great idea - swimming!
Oh? That sounds like something you would enjoy.
That's what I thought. I love playing on the beach, so this should be a piece of cake.
It will be hard, but I think you'll enjoy it. Do you want time off to start practicing?
Sure! Though, Captain, do you think you could join me?
Me?
Yes. I would really appreciate training alongside you.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not a master swimmer, but maybe you could give me lessons.
I'm a little worried about getting my clothes wet.
I'd love to spend some time at the beach with you.

Fields.DialogueText: Neither am I, but we could learn together. I'd like giving you private lessons.
Oh, that's right - you humans have more trouble with that kind of stuff. We'll just have to get you a swimsuit! I'd enjoy seeing that, honestly.
Are we... still talking about sports?
Perth! Look out for that wave!
Uh, oh...
What's wrong?
Those aren't natural waves, Captain. You know what that means.
I certainly do. Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Hey there, Amphy. Sunning yourself up here?
Yep. Walking about topside helps me dry off after a long swim.
You'll be ready for the Olympics, whenever they actually happen.
What do you mean, Captain?
With the war going on, it might be a while before everyone can come together for one.
A pity. Just like with World's Fairs, we need things like the Olympics to stop and celebrate life.
I couldn't agree more. Say, what country would you represent?
Australia, naturally. Unless I get shipped around to someplace else before then.

Fields.MenuText: Honor all of your countries, past and present.
Whoever you represent, I am certain that you will make them proud.
Even without the Olympics, you could still go swimming with me.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I will not let any of them down.
Thanks! I'll do my best. Maybe I'd even make you proud of me, Captain.
How sweet of you, Captain. I like that idea.
I wonder if the Belles out here on the oceans count as a nation of their own.
That's an interesting thought. We would be quite the fusion of different cultures.
You'll need to come together in one form, if we hope to survive these never-ending Morgana attacks.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, I wanted to ask you something.
Now?! Okay, fine, go ahead.
Well, it's a little troublesome, and I don't want to be a nuisance...
Perth, we've only got a moment before battle. Just tell me what you want to say!
I want to have a concert.
A concert?
Yes, with music from around the world. I just think, this would be a way to share my music with others, and experience their own music.

Fields.MenuText: Sure you won't get annoyed with the "foreign noises?"
It will take a lot of work and cooperation, you know.
That sounds like a lot of fun for everybody.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll handle it. I need to try to face my prejudices, if I'm to move forward.
I know, and I will take full responsibility.
Exactly. This is something that can bring everyone together and lighten up the dismal atmosphere.
Okay, you have my blessing. Let's do our best with it.
Thank you! We need to get to work right away.
After we finish this battle.
Oh, right, sorry!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Which one should I do?
What's bugging you, Amphy?
I'm trying to decide what kind of song to perform in the concert.
Well, you know a variety of different songs. You should have plenty to choose from.
That's the problem. I probably should do an Australian song, since I will be representing my country. But my love for music came from Greece. And what about my English ones?
I see. That is a difficult choice. Can't you do one for each of them?
I don't want to be selfish when I'm sharing the concert with other people. How can I decide?

Fields.MenuText: Take your time and think things through. This is an important decision.
Go with your gut feeling.
Does your song have to be restricted to just one cultural form? You have a way of giving a unique blend to all of them at once.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I have to be careful about this, and look at all the options.
Easier said than done. Especially when I'm not sure any of them are the right decision.
I never thought about it like that...
I think I have a solution.
You do? What?
I will compose an original ballad for the concert, one that brings out the best of all my ties.
That's great! What will it be about, though?
It will be about our journey out here, as we all find adventure and forge new bonds.
Well, pay attention then, because the latest stanza for it is coming right up.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I don't like the looks of these waters. It seems like Scylla or Charybdis is right beneath us.
You might be right. This whole area is a graveyard of sunken ships, apparently.
Spooky. I wonder if this is where Morganas are born.
I certainly hope not! But stay alert for anything dangerous.
Aye, aye! But, Captain, I was wondering...
Yes?
Do you think we could go diving for treasure?
There probably isn't much treasure down there, and besides, you wouldn't be able to swim that far down.
Okay, but it would still be fun to explore the sea. Please?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think it's safe - the waves are kind of rough around here.
I'm worried about the ships - we need to make sure nothing happens to them.
We should stay on guard for Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: That just means that I'll get some extra swimming practice. If I can't take these little ripples, I won't stand a chance at the Olympics.
I suppose you're right. We don't want to join the other boats at the bottom.
Poo. But no other choice, I guess.
Look, we can go swimming and adventuring later. I just don't think now is the best time.
You'd better find the time soon. It feels like ages since we had a proper date.
Perth...
I'll take that as a "yes"! I hope it's something good...
@BATTLE
Oh, and I think I've discovered why all those ships are down there. Now we just need to make the problem go away.
*ALARM*
There! That's one day... and a lot still to go.
What are you working on?
Oh, I'm polishing up my song for the concert.
I see. How's it coming along?
Great! I think that I am almost... hmm... a tenth of the way there.
Wait, a tenth? Perth, why is it taking you so long to finish it?
These sorts of things take time, you know. Writing and composing music is complicated.
I know, but you need to avoid getting bogged down in all the details.
That's not the issue. I'm going through verses steadily, before I finish everything.
Everything... just how long is your song going to be?
I'm thinking at least two hours, but you never know until you reach the...
Perth, the whole concert might not last two hours. You'll have to cut it down.
But an epic like this – made for everyone's story – deserves a full showing. Others might not recognize the beauty of it, but I respect the art of poetry, and will uphold it in my music.

Fields.MenuText: Won't your throat get sore?
We all have to make compromises to share the stage.
When planning a performance, you should take your audience's tastes into consideration.

Fields.DialogueText: Belles don't have to worry about that. Then again, if you shared some of the lines, there could be trouble.
You're right. I promised to make this something for everyone, so I cannot hog everything.
That's a good point. I didn't look at it like that.
All right, I'll limit my performance. It's a shame, though, to put all of this verse to waste.
How about this? You just include a sample of your song – a few verses – in the concert, and then you can share the rest with me later.
Really? And you promise that you won't get bored?
Perth? Not now. We have to take an intermission to deal with some unruly listeners.
@BATTLE
I promise. I'd love to hear your music in a private setting.
Sounds like a date to me! Oh, but what should I wear? That could take some time to figure out, too...
*ALARM*
Oh, Captain! I have a little surprise for you...
What sort of surprise?
You'll see...
Why do I have an uneasy feeling about this? Okay, what is it?
TA DA! It's a bunny! Isn't it cute?
Ahem. This is when you explain yourself.
I thought it would make an excellent gift. Maybe a present for my superiors when I report to Australia?
You definitely don't want to do that.
Why ever not?
Rabbits are an invasive species there. They've torn through the local ecosystem.
Where does that leave me, then? Oh, this poor rabbit is just like me – an outsider with no home!
I didn't mean it like that, Amphy. Why are you taking this so hard?
Do I really belong anywhere? Can I ever really fit in?

Fields.MenuText: You're no rabbit. Australia will love you.
You can adapt, I just know it.
What matters is being aware of the world around you, and knowing how to live in harmony.

Fields.DialogueText: So you're saying... that you think... I'm lovable?
Thanks, Captain. I want to impress you. Er, Australia. I want to impress Australia.
I'll have to do my best to learn about Australia, so that I never make a faux pas. I don't want them to reject me.
Can we get back to talking about the rabbit? And how we're getting rid of it?
Hold on, I just spotted a Morgana.
How convenient.
@BATTLE
By far, the worst invasive species of all!
Is that another book on Australian history? You'll fall asleep if you don't take a break.
Actually, I was reading a bit about the Caribbean.
Sounds like a great vacation spot. I wouldn't mind going sometime.
Back when I was Amphion, I helped patrol the Atlantic territories.
You must know a lot about the Caribbean, then.
I know all about the best beaches, and the finest restaurants. Though I suspect I missed some of the secrets.
Secrets?
I docked at the island's shores, of course, but we never went past the civilized front offered to us. Maybe there's more to discover.

Fields.MenuText: It's never too late to find out.
At least you have some memories of those places. That has to count for something, right?
You had me at beaches and restaurants.

Fields.DialogueText: Now you've got me wondering what we'll find!
I wouldn't mind making some new memories, though. Don't you feel the same way?
Take me to sometime soon! I'm certain we'd have fun together.
You can show me some of your old spots first, and then we can discover new things together.
You've got me quite excited to go. Please don't cancel our date!
First things first. No vacations until we put these Morganas down.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Perth! I want to have a word with you.
Captain! I was looking for you, too. I lost something precious.
Is this rabbit what you were referring to?
Oh, Little Portie! You're okay! Thank you, Captain.
You're welcome. But I thought I told you to get the rabbit off the ship, remember?
But, Captain!
First it's a rabbit... and then the next thing you know, we have penguins running around serving drinks.
Come on, please? Can't you have a little pity on this cute thing?

Fields.MenuText: It might get hurt out here.
If you want to keep it, you can't let it run loose. That's what started the trouble in Australia.
It is kind of fluffy...

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but I will do my best to protect him. Just like I do for you, Captain.
You don't need to remind me.
I know! Isn't it just adorable?
All right, you can keep it.
Oh, thank you, Captain! Make sure you thank him too, Portie. We'll take good care of you, we promise.
Wait... "We?"
Now, then, would you please get Portie to safety? We have some Morganas coming to call.
@BATTLE
Captain, are you busy?
Not at the moment. We finally have a chance to relax for a little bit before the next battle.
You are certain that I'm not disturbing you?
No, no, I appreciate your company. We haven't had as much time together lately.
I might have a solution, actually. Maybe we could perform a duet for the concert?
I'd enjoy that! Just let me know when you finish the lyrics, then.
What if we each did a verse, and then blended them together?
You want me to write a song with you?
Yes. Do you think you could write a few pieces we could sing?

Fields.MenuText: I'm afraid I don't have much in the way of songwriting ability.
It might not be as harmonious as you would like, though.
I'll do my best with it.

Fields.DialogueText: You won't be alone. If you need help, I'll be happy to lend a hand.
You often urge me to try new things. Why not take your own advice?
I like that quality in you! Let's both try our hardest, both in writing and on the stage.
Lyrics based on our journey together, you said? I'll see if any inspiration can flow to me.
I think some inspiration is flowing right this way. Or writer's block, depending on how you look at a pack of Morganas.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain! We need to do something physical together. Could we play a game, please?
Um... sure. What did you have in mind? Shuffleboard again?
No, I was actually thinking of some good, old-fashioned cricket.
Cricket?
Yep. It's quite popular in Australia. So, do you want to play?

Fields.MenuText: It might be a little tough to do without the balls going overboard.
We'll need full teams for a complete game, you know.
You'll need to teach me the rules.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. It's not a chaotic sport, like Yankee baseball.
I know. We'll go round up some friends I've made.
Sure. It will only take a little bit, and then we can play.
All right, all right... I guess I could play for a bit.
Um, actually, I think we should postpone.
Huh? Why? Bad weather coming in or something?
Sort of.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... Well, the song is ready.
Good. We should probably practice for the concert a few times.
How about now?
Sure. After you.
Say, Captain?
Something else you want to talk about?
We... really have come a long way, haven't we?
We certainly have.
I know that I had to shorten the song, but I think... I'm going to keep writing it.
For how long?
Until the end, wherever it comes. This journey... it means a lot to all of us, in ways we never realized when we began.
And we don't know where it's going to end, either.
But, anyway, I... do you think you could help me with the song?

Fields.MenuText: No, but I can make my own song to accompany yours.
Sure. Let's do our best.
Let's take it one step at a time.

Fields.DialogueText: I see.
Yes. Our song will live on for decades to come.
Good point. Time to get on with the song we have right now.
Well, time to sing...
Not now. I see a Morgana.
Of course. Let's still sing while we destroy it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain?
I see them.
Sound the klaxon - this is going to get ugly fast!
@BATTLE
Captain! I can't find Little Portie anywhere!
What?! I told you to keep an eye on him!
I know, but I got distracted when the Morganas showed up, and he escaped from his bath.
Do you have any idea where he went?
Well, probably somewhere with a lot of food. The mess hall, I'd guess.
Great, as if we don't have enough problems.
Please, will you help me? I'm sorry about all the trouble, but he's really grown on me.

Fields.MenuText: All right. You won't be able to concentrate until we do.
Just try to be careful the next time, please?
Don't worry. We'll find our pet.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. Let me know if you find him.
I will, I promise.
"Our" pet?
(time passes)
Found him!
Oh! Is he all right?
I think so – just a little nervous.
Great. Could you take him back to my quarters? I'm late to baking lessons with the cook.
Fine, Fine. Oh well, he is a cute little fellow. Hey, hold on until I get you to the litter box!
Nuts. That was a slip of the tongue.
Ha ha ha!
*ALARM*
How are things looking, Perth?
It's getting messy, Captain.
The Morganas are still well outside firing range, but we think their planes have been... agitating birds nearby.
There have been attacks all over the ship, and....
Don't worry, I'll just –
Captain!
Wha...? Did you just save me from... what, an albatross?
I think so.
And you... you used a boomerang?
I... just somehow knew where to aim. That was close, wasn't it?

Fields.MenuText: Well, I didn't have my face sliced off, so don't worry.
Thanks for the save. I owe you one.
Let's both try to be more careful - a rookie mistake could cost us everything.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll always worry about you, Captain. I'm just happy you're still here.
We're already even.
Yes. We can't afford to lose when we've come so far.
Sorry if I scared you there.
I not scared any more, Captain. Now I know that my heart will always guide my aim.
Let's just deal with these Morganas and hope the birds have the sense to escape!
@BATTLE
How doth the crocodile swim through the waters, a kangaroo bouncing by and...
Enjoying the view up here again?
Kind of. Just babbling ideas for lyrics. And thinking.
I've learned you do both of those things quite a bit. A penny for your thoughts, Perth.
You know, Captain, it's kind of interesting how things don't turn out how you'd expect them.  A few years ago, I never imagined being part of Australia, much less... all this.
The Morganas took everyone by surprise.
Yes, but I've changed a lot from the Belle I used to be.
You're still yourself, Amph. You've just added new experiences to who you are. You've grown.
Well said, Captain. That's something I like about you. No... I'm not sure if "like" is the best word.
Oh? I do my best.
Captain, you're a true companion. Our time together has opened me up to the world and the future. I... I appreciate you intensely, and I don't want it to end.
I appreciate you, too.
It's a wonderful view from up here...
I don't want us to sing a duet together for the crew.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't expect you to get stage fright.

Fields.DialogueText: I just don't want to share you with an audience.
If we're going to make music together, I know what I want. I want you all to myself.
I'm glad to hear you say that. You had me going for a minute, there.
I finally have what I want right now, Captain. Something I love.
You realize what this means, of course. We'll have to keep fighting for it.
Ugh, Morganas! Then our private duet will have to wait... but only for a little bit longer!

Fields.MenuText: You hate the lyrics I wrote. Is that it?
You don't think my voice is ready for an audience?

Fields.DialogueText: I assure you, I'm not afraid to perform.
On the contrary! I loved them.
Goodness, no. Your voice is lovely, Captain.
